docTitle.titlePart: Bending Fatigue Tests on Stays Cables

front.div:
The results of an experimental study of the fatigue behavior of cable stays under vibration are
presented. The purpose of the study is the determination of the fatigue damage caused by bending in stay
cables due to wind-rain induced vibrations. The stays considered consist of bare 7-wire prestressing
strand surrounded by a portland cement grout and a high-density polyethylene pipe.
